text: Andrew James Dalrymple Gill (1 January 1956 â€“ 1 February 2020) was a British post-punk guitarist and record producer. He was the lead guitarist for the British rock band Gang of Four, which he co-founded in 1976. Gill was known for his albums such as Entertainment! (1979) and Solid Gold (1981) and hit singles such as "At Home He's a Tourist," "Damaged Goods," "Anthrax," "What We All Want" and "I Love a Man in a Uniform". ==Death== Gill died on 1 February 2020 of pneumonia in London, aged 64. ==References== ==Other websites== *GillMusic website *Gang of Four website *Video interview with Andy Gill Category:1956 births Category:2020 deaths Category:English rock guitarists Category:English songwriters Category:Punk musicians Category:British record producers Category:Deaths from pneumonia Category:Disease-related deaths in London Category:Musicians from Manchester
